metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0736 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Apache HTTP Server versions 2.4.0 to 2.4.23, mod_session_crypto was encrypting its data/cookie using the configured ciphers with possibly either CBC or ECB modes of operation (AES256-CBC by default), hence no selectable or builtin authenticated encryption. This made it vulnerable to padding oracle attacks, particularly with CBC.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0736` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-macro - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
No subscription required

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14').
apache2 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.14').
